script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Hi there! Come on in and have a seat. I see we're back to check on Emma's eczema today.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Yes, and honestly, nothing seems to be working. The cream you gave us last month isn't helping at all.

script.speaker: child
script.text: My skin still itches a lot, especially at night.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I'm sorry to hear that, Emma. Let's take a look and see what's going on. Can you tell me which areas are bothering you the most?

script.speaker: child
script.text: My arms and behind my knees. And sometimes my face gets red.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: She's been scratching so much she's bleeding in some spots. I feel like we've tried everything.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I can hear how frustrating this has been for both of you. Let me ask - have you been using the hydrocortisone cream twice daily as we discussed?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Yes, religiously. Morning and night. But it's like putting water on her skin - no improvement at all.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: And what about the moisturizer routine? Are we still doing that throughout the day?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Three times a day with the Cetaphil cream you recommended. Nothing's changed.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Emma, can you roll up your sleeves for me so I can take a look at your arms?

script.speaker: child
script.text: Okay, but don't touch the scratchy parts too hard.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I'll be very gentle, I promise. [examining] I can see the inflammation is more widespread than before, and there are some areas of lichenification from the scratching.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Lichenifi-what? Is that bad?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Lichenification - it just means the skin has thickened from chronic scratching. It's not dangerous, but it shows we need a stronger approach.

script.speaker: child
script.text: Will it go away?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Yes, sweetie, it will get better with the right treatment. Let me check behind your knees too. [examining]

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I can see why the mild hydrocortisone isn't cutting it anymore. Have you noticed any new triggers lately - different soaps, foods, stress?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Well, she started kindergarten this year. Could that be making it worse?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Absolutely. New environment, different stress levels, possibly different hand soaps at school. That could definitely be a factor.

script.speaker: child
script.text: I don't like the soap at school. It smells funny and makes my hands feel weird.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That's a very important clue, Emma. Thank you for telling me that. [typing] I think we need to step up our treatment plan.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: What does that mean exactly? Stronger steroids?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I'm going to prescribe a medium-potency topical steroid called triamcinolone. It's stronger than what we tried before but still very safe for Emma's age.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: We'll use it twice daily for two weeks, then step down to once daily. And I want to add a prescription moisturizer with ceramides.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: And that should work better than what we've been doing?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I believe it will. We're also going to talk to your school about providing a gentle, fragrance-free soap for Emma to use.

script.speaker: child
script.text: Can I bring my own soap to school?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That's a great idea! We can definitely arrange that. I'll write a note for your teacher explaining your special soap needs.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: How long before we should see improvement?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: You should start seeing less redness and itching within a few days. Let's plan to check back in two weeks to see how we're doing.

script.speaker: child
script.text: Will I stop itching at night?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That's exactly what we're aiming for, Emma. Better sleep for everyone!
